existing_features.title: Create the main storefront page for the e-commerce subscription store named ‚ÄúGen-Z Nexus Solution‚Äù with a dark/slate premium theme and red accents, applied consistently across all sections (typography, buttons, cards, badges, inputs).

Implement the top Notice Bar as a red, horizontally scrolling (marquee-style) strip fixed at the very top of the page that displays exactly: ‚Äú‚è∞ Service Time: 12 PM‚Äì1 AM | üè∞ Friday After 2:30 PM‚Äù.
Create the Header layout with: (1) a logo on the left, (2) a functional search input centered, and (3) a shopping bag icon on the right showing a cart item count badge.

Implement the Hero section with a sleek banner containing the headline ‚ÄúAll Your Favorite SUBSCRIPTIONS in One Place‚Äù and a ‚ÄúShop Now‚Äù button that has a pulse animation and scrolls/jumps the user to the product grid when clicked.

Create a Fanflix-style product grid with product cards for exactly: Netflix Premium, Spotify, YouTube Premium, and Chess.com Diamond Membership. Each card must display: a ‚ÄúSale‚Äù badge, star ratings, crossed-out original price, and a current price in Tk format (example: ‚ÄúTk 350‚Äù).
Add product detail interactions per product card: duration toggle for ‚Äú1 Month‚Äù and ‚Äú3 Month‚Äù, and a functional quantity selector with ‚Äú+‚Äù and ‚Äú-‚Äù controls (minimum 1).
Implement dynamic pricing calculation so that when a user changes quantity (and/or duration if pricing differs), the total price updates instantly in the UI for that product card.
Implement real-time search filtering: typing into the header search bar filters the visible product cards immediately by product name.

Implement a Direct Buy (‚ÄúBuy It Now‚Äù) flow: clicking ‚ÄúBuy It Now‚Äù collects Product Name, selected Duration, and Quantity, then redirects the user to WhatsApp at https://wa.me/8801326060586 with a pre-filled message containing those fields.

Implement a cart system: each product card has an ‚ÄúAdd to cart‚Äù button that (1) adds the selected configuration (product, duration) with quantity, (2) shows a ‚ÄúSuccess‚Äù toast notification, and (3) updates the header shopping bag count to reflect total items in cart.
Add a trust/checkout section that displays a ‚ÄúGuaranteed Safe Checkout‚Äù banner and shows icons for bKash, Nagad, Visa, and Mastercard in a visually consistent style with the dark theme.

Add a Customer Reviews section that displays a list of reviews with a visible ‚ÄúVerified Buyer‚Äù tag and provides a ‚ÄúWrite a Review‚Äù form that allows submitting a new review (name, rating, and review text). Submitted reviews should appear in the reviews list after submission.

Ensure mobile optimization and responsiveness across the entire page (notice bar, header, hero, product grid, trust section, reviews) and add a floating green WhatsApp Support button fixed to the bottom-right of the viewport that links to https://wa.me/8801326060586.

Investigate the previous deployment failure and fix the underlying build/deploy issues so the project can successfully compile and deploy with the standard Internet Computer workflow (dfx build/deploy) without manual intervention.

Add a deterministic ‚Äúretry deployment‚Äù workflow that re-runs deployment from a clean, known-good state (e.g., clearing derived build artifacts as needed) and produces consistent results across retries.
Ensure any user-facing error text shown in the app (if applicable) is in English and provides an actionable next step (e.g., ‚ÄúPlease refresh and try again‚Äù or ‚ÄúContact support on WhatsApp‚Äù).

Fix the deployment failure caused by an invalid domain/canister naming value containing underscores (e.g., "gen-z_nexus_solution"). Update the project‚Äôs deployment configuration so all relevant identifiers use only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens (5‚Äì50 chars) and the app can deploy successfully with the standard `dfx deploy` workflow.

Harden the deterministic retry deployment workflow so it reliably redeploys from a clean state and surfaces clear, actionable errors in English when deployment fails (including naming validation failures).

Complete and update `frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md` so it documents the exact go-live steps (including the retry command) and includes a short troubleshooting section for the underscore/invalid-name failure with the correct naming rules.
